poem:
### Red Tape Lullaby

A forest of forms,  
each leaf a petition  
for care under hidden canopies.  
They promise health,  
yet the pathways tangle,  
and the ones in need—  
those rooted deeply in pain—  
are left to sway in wind,  
a lullaby sung in hushed tones,  
waiting to be heard by  
the elusive ear of mercy.
